address: Administrative Head Office: Isokun area, along Oyo-Iseyin road, Oyo. P M B 1033, Oyo, Oyo State, Nigeria.
openingHours: Not explicitly stated as fixed hours for visitors. '24/7 Contact' mentioned for administrative contact, not visitor access.
bestTimeToVisit: Not specified, but generally, national parks are best visited during the dry season for wildlife viewing and easier movement.

accessibility.gettingThere: Easily accessible from southwestern and northwestern Nigeria. Access via Oyo-Iseyin road to the office in Oyo-Isokun. From Ibadan: Take a bus to Oyo Town (approximately 300-500 NGN, 1-1.5 hours), then a motorcycle taxi (okada) to the park entrance (approximately 200-300 NGN). Hiring a local taxi from Ibadan costs around 5,000-10,000 NGN.
accessibility.nearestCitiesForAccommodation: Saki, Iseyin, Igboho, Sepeteri, Tede, Kishi, and Igbeti

name: Agodi Parks and Gardens
description: A sprawling adventure site covering 54 hectares, owned by the Oyo State Government. It is a multi-use land area for forestry, park boating, fishery, a zoo, and general recreation. It features an artificial lake and is currently undergoing rehabilitation to become a world-class resort.
address: Parliament Road, beside Oyo State secretariat, Ibadan North Local Government, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

contactInfo.email: info@elastudio.co.za (for Earthworks Landscape Architects, a consultant, not direct park management)

openingHours.primary: Mondays - Thursdays: 10:00 AM - 8:00 PM; Fridays - Saturdays: 10:00 AM - 9:00 PM; Sundays: 12:00 PM - 9:00 PM
openingHours.contradiction: Another source states 'the park closes at 6 PM daily' and specifies 'Operating Hours: Mondays - Saturdays (10AM - 6PM) and Sundays (12Noon - 6PM)'

entryFee.primary: NGN 1,000 for adults, NGN 500 for children
entryFee.contradiction: Another source states NGN 500 per person and NGN 500 for swimming pool access

bestTimeToVisit: Festive periods and public holidays, or during the dry season. Weekdays are less crowded for a quieter experience.

accessibility.gettingThere: Not explicitly detailed, but its central Ibadan location suggests easy access by local transport.

name: Mapo Hall
description: An iconic colonial-era hall, constructed in 1929, symbolizing Ibadan's rich history and cultural heritage. It was designed by Engr. Taffy Jones in 1925 and served as Nigeria's first Local Government council office. Situated on the renowned Mapo Hill, it affords panoramic views of a significant portion of the city.
address: Mapo Hill, Oja-Oba, Old Quarter, Ibadan 200263, Oyo, Nigeria. Its main entrance is on Ogunmola Street, directly facing Mapo Road.

contactInfo.phone: +234 903 903 3821, +234 703 575 3053, +234 806 518 8616 (General Ibadan service numbers, not direct for Mapo Hall management)

openingHours: Stated as 'Open 24h'. This likely refers to the accessibility of the exterior and surrounding grounds, not necessarily interior access or services.
entryFee: Not explicitly mentioned for general entry.
bestTimeToVisit: Not specified, but attending during a cultural event or public gathering would offer a more dynamic experience. Early morning or late afternoon might provide optimal lighting for photography from the hill.

accessibility.gettingThere: Easily accessible from Ibadan city center. Can be reached by walking, public bus, or bicycle.

name: Ado-Awaye Suspended Lake (Iyake Lake)
description: One of only two suspended lakes in the world, with the other being Hanging Lake in Colorado, USA. It is situated in the Iyake Mountains, making it a significant natural and geological wonder. The lake holds historical, spiritual, religious, and scientific significance.
address: Ado-Awaye, Iseyin Local Government, Oyo State, Nigeria.
uniqueFeatures: One of only two suspended lakes in the world
Located in the Iyake Mountains, offering elevated terrain and scenic viewpoints
Holds historical, spiritual, religious, and scientific value
bestTimeToVisit: Not specified, but hiking to a suspended lake would generally be optimal in dry weather conditions.

name: Oyo State Cultural Centre
description: A vibrant hub dedicated to preserving and promoting the artistic traditions of Oyo State. It features galleries, performance spaces, and exhibition areas showcasing traditional and contemporary art, music, and dance of the Yoruba people.
address: CV3W+37F, Mokola Hill, Ibadan, Oyo, NG.
openingHours: Monday - Friday: 8:00 AM - 11:30 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM - 11:30 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM
entryFee: Mostly free for sightseeing. One source describes it as a '100% free app-based travel guide' implying no entry fee.
bestTimeToVisit: During cultural festivals for unique performances and exhibitions.

accessibility.gettingThere: From IITA Forest Reserve: Head southeast on the main road towards Ibadan for approximately 12 km to Mokola Hill. From Dugbe area: Take a bus towards Mokola (fare approximately 100 Naira), disembark at Mokola and walk up the hill for approximately 300 meters. Ample parking available.

name: Bower's Tower
description: A scenic historical and cultural site, erected in 1936 in honor of Captain R.L. Bower, a colonial officer who administered Ibadan (1893-1897). Located on Oke-Aremo, the highest hill in Ibadan, it offers a panoramic view of approximately 80% of the city. It was originally constructed as a watchtower to monitor anti-social behavior and protect the city.
address: Oke-Aremo, Ibadan North Local Government, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. On the summit of Oke-Are, Ibadan.

contactInfo.phone: +234 903 903 3821, +234 703 575 3053, +234 806 518 8616 (General Ibadan service numbers, not direct for the tower's management)

entryFee: Not explicitly mentioned for general entry. A package tour including Bower's Tower costs US$620.00, but this is not the individual entry fee.
bestTimeToVisit: Early morning or late afternoon for optimal lighting and stunning backdrops for photography.

accessibility.gettingThere: Walking from Mapo Hall: Head east on Mapo Hill Road, then Oyo Road, then Oke Are Road (approximately 2.5 km total). Public Transport (Bus): Take a bus towards Oke Are from Ibadan city center. Bicycle: Rent a bicycle from a local shop and follow a similar route. Visitors are advised to wear comfortable shoes as the path can be steep and uneven.

name: University of Ibadan Zoological Garden (UI Zoo)
description: A popular tourist center in Nigeria, maintained by the University of Ibadan. It exhibits wild animals primarily for conservation, research, education, and entertainment. The garden houses a wide array of mammals, birds, reptiles, and amphibians.
address: CVVV+4WR, Appleton Rd, Ibadan 200132, Oyo, Nigeria.
openingHours: 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM daily, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

entryFee.primary: NGN 1,500 for adults, NGN 1,000 for children. Discounts for school children (in uniform) and UI students with valid IDs. Camera use for photo/video shoots: NGN 1,000.
entryFee.contradiction: Another source states NGN 500 for adults, children, and UI students, also mentioning a past consideration for reduced student prices.

uniqueFeatures: Maintained by a university, ensuring a focus on conservation and education
Home to diverse wildlife, including elephants and various monkeys
One of Nigeria's popular tourist centers
bestTimeToVisit: Not specified, but zoos are generally suitable for daytime visits.

accessibility.gettingThere: Located within the University of Ibadan campus.

name: Cocoa House
description: Nigeria's first skyscraper, constructed in 1965. It stands as a testament to Ibadan's economic importance, particularly in the cocoa industry. It has been transformed into a modern coworking space, blending historical significance with contemporary innovation.
address: Liebu Bypass, Ibadan, YO, NG. Located at the intersection with Liebu Bypass, approximately 500 meters from the intersection.
openingHours: Monday - Friday: 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM; Saturday: 9:30 AM - 4:30 PM; Sunday: Closed (implied, as not listed).
entryFee: Not explicitly mentioned. As a coworking space, general public access might be limited or require specific arrangements.
bestTimeToVisit: Weekdays for a quieter atmosphere if visiting for work/productivity; attending networking events is recommended to connect with local entrepreneurs.

accessibility.gettingThere: Walking from Dugbe Market: Head southwest on Dugbe Street, then Ibadan-Bodija Road, then Liebu Bypass (approximately 2.5 km total). Public Transport (Bus): Take a bus towards Bodija, disembark at Orita Challenge Roundabout, then walk to Liebu Bypass. Motorcycle Taxi (Okada): Direct ride, 10-15 minutes depending on traffic.

ownership: Not explicitly stated, but likely corporate or government-owned given its history and current use as a coworking space.

name: Irefin Palace
description: An ancient palace in Ibadan, constructed over 200 years ago using traditional mud and timber. It comprises approximately 185 rooms and remains standing, serving as a prime example of indigenous Yoruba architecture. It holds historical, cultural, artistic, spiritual, and traditional significance.
address: Irefin, Ibadan North East Local Government, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. (Note: One source incorrectly lists 'Ibadan U.i, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria' as an address).

accessibility.gettingThere: Located in Irefin, Ibadan North East Local Government.

ownership: Implied to be family or community-owned

name: Trans Wonderland Amusement Park
description: Recognized as the biggest amusement park in Nigeria, situated on the former site of the Old Ibadan Airport. It offers attractions that are described as similar to those found at Disney World.
address: CWP5+QCF, Ibadan 200132, Oyo, Nigeria. (Note: Another address provided is 5 Pepsi Rd, Oluyole, Ibadan 200113, Oyo, Nigeria).

contactInfo.phone: No direct contact number found. General 'Contact us' for the website, not the park itself.

openingHours: Not explicitly stated, but 'Recommended sightseeing time: 2-4 hours' is mentioned.

entryFee.primary: Tickets for entry were printed as NGN 200 but sold for NGN 300. Additionally, extra tickets are required for each ride, costing NGN 300 per ride.

facilities: An old gokart/car race arena is now an empty shed
ownership: Not explicitly stated, but implied to be a commercial entity.

name: International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA)
description: A significant agricultural research hub established in 1967, focusing on food staples and horticulture crops vital to African farmers. It occupies approximately 1,000 hectares, which includes a 300-hectare forest reserve, experimental plots, screenhouses, and laboratories. The institute also provides hospitality and leisure facilities for visitors.
address: PMB 5320, Oyo Road, Ibadan 200001, Oyo State, Nigeria.
openingHours: Not explicitly stated for general visitor access, but 'various support units that ensure the smooth running of the institute 24 hours a day, all year round' suggests continuous operation. Prior booking is required for visitors.
entryFee: Not explicitly mentioned. Prior booking is required.
